jmortgage.payment
Class DefaultPmtCalculator

java.lang.Object
  jmortgage.payment.DefaultPmtCalculator
All Implemented Interfaces:
PmtCalculator
public final class DefaultPmtCalculator
extends Object
implements PmtCalculator

The default implementation of PmtCalculator. This object calculates a mortgage payment for the United States. This object is immutable, so its thread safety is guaranteed.

Since:
1.0
Author:
David Armstrong

Constructor Detail

DefaultPmtCalculator

public DefaultPmtCalculator(Interval interval,
                            Double loanAmt,
                            Double interestRate,
                            Integer years)
Creates a new instance with the specified interval, loan amount, interest rate, and years. This constructor is available for the benefit of JMortgageFactory, which uses reflection to build objects. Reflection will not find constructors that take primitives as arguments.

Parameters:
interval - The Interval value
loanAmt - The loan amount value
interestRate - The interest rate value
years - The number of years in the mortgage term

DefaultPmtCalculator

public DefaultPmtCalculator(Interval interval,
                            double loanAmt,
                            double interestRate,
                            int years)
Creates a new instance with the specified interval, loan amount, interest rate, and years.

loanAmt - The loan amount value

calcPmt

public double calcPmt()
Calculates and returns the payment amount rounded.

Specified by:
calcPmt in interface PmtCalculator
Returns:
double payment amount rounded

calcPmtUnrounded

public double calcPmtUnrounded()
Calculates and returns the payment amount unrounded. This method is used by implementations of FixedAmortizationBuilder when building an amortization schedule

Specified by:
calcPmtUnrounded in interface PmtCalculator
Returns:
double payment amount unrounded
